title: Epic: City Logo Lab Upgrades (Scale, Schemes, Skyline, Trucks)
description:
Upgrade the `/labs/city-logo` playground into a high-power tuning surface for the Living City wordmark.

## Objective
Make it fast to iterate on:
- Visual scale (voxel/pixel density) + overall sizing (including full-width preview)
- Skyline/building silhouette parameters
- Coordinated color schemes (text/buildings/vehicles) to improve legibility and site-wide design cohesion
- Additional vehicle variety (trucks) while keeping rendering performant

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Lab supports adjusting voxel scale, preview width mode (fixed vs full width), and preview size.
- [ ] Lab supports adjusting skyline parameters (min/max height, segment widths) and these affect render output.
- [ ] Lab supports selecting a color scheme (curated palettes) that affects wordmark + vehicles and improves contrast/legibility.
- [ ] Trucks are implemented as an additional vehicle actor (configurable/toggleable).
- [ ] Rendering remains performant (bounded DOM; batch where appropriate).
- [ ] Playwright visual baselines cover the lab’s key scenes and remain stable.
- [ ] Motion sanity checks exist so we can self-verify animation/layout during development.

- [ ] Local verification completed (CI-equivalent commands + visual checks in logo lab).
- [ ] GitHub Actions CI is green for the pushed commit on main before closing this epic.

## Out of Scope
- Accessibility work
- Documentation
- Legacy logo fallback / old header implementation

## Assumptions
- “Resolution” is implemented as **integer voxel scaling** and optional layout parameters (crisp edges), not arbitrary fractional scaling.
- Color customization is via **predefined schemes** (no free-form color picker in V1).
- Lab controls are shareable via URL query params so scenarios can be reproduced.

## Verification Protocol
- Use Node 20 (CI parity): `PATH=/opt/homebrew/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH`
- Local CI-equivalent: `pnpm lint`, `pnpm lint:knip`, `pnpm lint:cycles`, `pnpm type-check`, `pnpm test`, `pnpm build`, `pnpm bundle:check`
- Visual: `LABS_CITY_LOGO=1 SKIP_DB=1 pnpm build && LABS_CITY_LOGO=1 SKIP_DB=1 pnpm start` then `pnpm test:visual`
- Motion sanity: run a Playwright motion smoke test (frame-to-frame change) against `/labs/city-logo` when simulation is playing.
- CI gate: after push, wait for GitHub Actions to be green (`gh run list -c <sha>`) before closing issues and starting the next one.

title: Epic: Focused core flows + landing clarity
description:
Complete implementation of a simplified, high-value experience focused on the 3 most powerful flows: Scan -> Workbench export, Library -> Workbench reuse, and Translate -> Workbench conversion.

## Objective
Deliver a landing page and core flows that make the fastest path to value obvious, reduce choice overload, and guide first-time users to a successful export in minutes.

## User stories (guide for all interfaces)
1) As a repo owner, I scan a folder to see what instruction files load and go straight to Workbench to export agents.md.
2) As a team member, I start from a public artifact in Library and open it in Workbench to customize and export.
3) As a maintainer, I paste existing instructions into Translate to convert and export agents.md quickly.
4) As a new user, I land on the homepage and immediately understand the 3-step path to value with a single primary CTA.
5) As a cautious user, I want to confirm scans are local-only and no repo contents leave my device.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Landing page communicates the 3 core flows and has a single primary CTA hierarchy.
- [ ] Navigation and footer emphasize Scan, Workbench, Library, Translate, Docs only.
- [ ] Scan, Workbench, Library, and Translate flows each include a clear next-step CTA to export.
- [ ] Playwright coverage exists for each core flow with updated screenshots.
- [ ] Telemetry and monitoring confirm the core funnel from scan/translate/library to export.

## QA Evidence Requirements
- Playwright coverage for UI flows
- Screenshots stored in a consistent path
- DevTools MCP checks (console/network clean)
- FE/BE logs reviewed (no errors/warnings)
- CI green proof

## Risks/Assumptions
- No new backend APIs; use existing routes/components.
- Maintain local-only scan behavior and analytics redaction rules.
- Trimmed IA does not remove pages from routing; only de-emphasize in nav/landing.

## Out of Scope
- New auth features or billing.
- New artifact schemas or database migrations.

title: Epic: Atlas Context Files Atlas (Docs-as-Data)
description:
Build the Atlas "Context Files Atlas": a docs-as-data reference for context/instruction files across Copilot, Copilot CLI, Gemini CLI, Claude Code, Codex CLI, Cursor, and Windsurf.

## Objective
- Provide structured, versioned, evidence-backed facts (claims + citations) about how each platform loads and scopes context files.
- Render those facts into a premium UI (platform pages, compare matrix, changelog, simulator) with copyable examples.
- Keep Atlas up to date via a scheduled crawler → extractor → facts diff → PR workflow.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Atlas data contract: zod-validated facts JSON with claim-level evidence and a stable feature taxonomy.
- [ ] Atlas UI: `/atlas` section with platform detail pages rendering artifacts, files, scoping/precedence, claims + citations, and examples.
- [ ] Compare: matrix built from taxonomy + facts, with claim/evidence drilldowns and crosswalk equivalence.
- [ ] Search: generated index + in-Atlas search + command palette entry.
- [ ] Changelog: generated facts diffs + UI pages for browsing entries.
- [ ] Update pipeline: weekly scheduled GitHub Action opens a PR when facts change; never auto-merges.
- [ ] Security: crawler avoids SSRF, respects allowlists, stores minimal excerpts, and zip downloads are path-safe.

## Assumptions
- Atlas content lives in-repo under `atlas/` (facts/guides/examples/snapshots/changelog) and ships with the app.
- Facts extraction is best-effort and guarded by `expectedPhrases` to detect doc drift.
- Excerpts are short (<= ~200 chars) to avoid reproducing large portions of docs.

## Out of Scope
- Accessibility-specific work (keyboard nav, ARIA audits) beyond existing component behavior.
- Writing developer documentation about Atlas implementation.

- [ ] All primary routes (shell, home, browse, detail, builder, auth, static) render with V2 styling.
- [ ] Unit + visual tests pass with updated snapshots.

## Assumptions
- Tailwind + CSS variables remain the styling foundation.
- No data-model or backend changes; UI-only refactor.
- Accessibility and documentation are explicitly out of scope for this epic.

## Out of Scope
- WCAG/a11y remediation beyond existing behavior.
- New documentation/marketing content.
- Major IA or feature changes unrelated to styling.

title: Investigate RSC net::ERR_ABORTED in devtools smoke
description:
## Description
Devtools smoke currently ignores `_rsc` requests with `net::ERR_ABORTED`. Investigate the root cause and either scope the ignore to a known-safe cancellation pattern or remove the ignore once fixed.

Root cause: Next.js RSC fetches can be canceled during client transitions; these are benign for GET fetch requests with `_rsc` query parameters when the navigation completes.

## Acceptance criteria
- Root cause for `_rsc` aborts identified and documented.
- Devtools smoke suppression scoped to the specific benign request pattern OR removed.
- Updated script includes rationale comment and does not mask non-RSC request failures.

## Edge cases
- `_rsc` aborts during navigation or page reload.
- Legitimate `_rsc` failures (5xx/404) should still fail smoke.

## Files
- `scripts/qa/devtools-smoke.mjs`

## QA Evidence
- Local: `npm run compile`
- Local: `npm run lint`
- Local: `npm run test:unit`
- DevTools MCP: unavailable (`Transport closed`); Playwright fallback used.
- DevTools fallback: `node scripts/qa/devtools-smoke.mjs --url http://localhost:3000 --wait 5000 --timeout 30000`
- Logs: `rg -n -i "warn|error" /tmp/markdowntown-dev.log` (no matches)

## Close Notes
- Issues encountered: DevTools MCP `Transport closed`; Next dev hit EMFILE until `WATCHPACK_POLLING=true` set.
- Setup improvements: Prefer `WATCHPACK_POLLING=true` for local dev in this environment to avoid EMFILE.
- Debug info that would have helped: Next.js RSC fetches may abort during client transitions; ignore only GET fetch `_rsc` requests.
acceptance_criteria: Root cause identified; devtools smoke ignore is narrowly scoped or removed

title: Epic: SPEC v2.1 Scan + Workbench Alignment
description:
Complete implementation of SPEC v2.1 scan + workbench alignment.

## Objective
Deliver spec-aligned Scan + Workbench behaviors (platform accuracy, scan inputs, export warnings, conflict handling, secret scan gating) while keeping CI green after each task.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Cursor tool supported end-to-end in Scan (detection, insights, simulation)
- [ ] Shadowed/ignored files and last-verified rules visible in Scan
- [ ] ZIP scan supported with size limits and clear errors
- [ ] Export compatibility warnings + diff preview available in Workbench
- [ ] Save conflict detection prevents silent overwrites
- [ ] Secret scan gating blocks public publish by default
- [ ] Activation telemetry includes time-to-export

## QA Evidence Requirements
- Playwright coverage for Scan + Workbench UI flows
- Screenshots stored in a consistent path (docs/screenshots/spec-v21/...)
- DevTools MCP checks (console/network clean)
- FE/BE logs reviewed (no errors/warnings)
- CI green proof (npm run compile/lint/test:unit)

## Risks/Assumptions
- Assumes existing tasks cover: rule versioning (markdowntown-b5hl), paste-tree parser + commands (markdowntown-nc1c), golden repo suite + report inaccuracy (markdowntown-5w9i)
- Cursor platform behavior may shift; rules versioning mitigates drift
- Secret scan is best-effort; false positives require override UX

## Out of Scope
- Accessibility-specific work
- Documentation updates
- Social/gamification features

## Close Notes
- Issues encountered: DevTools MCP timeouts/transport closed during QA; Playwright CLI mismatch for Vitest E2E specs; PublishArtifactFlow E2E skipped without E2E_TEST_USER; recurring dev log warnings (Edge runtime crypto, import-in-the-middle externalization, Sentry/Turbopack).
- Setup improvements: improvements epic created (markdowntown-9r9d) with follow-up tasks for MCP reliability, E2E test user setup, and known warning documentation.
- Debug info that would have helped: MCP health troubleshooting steps and guidance for known dev-only warnings.

title: Infra: CI green + deploy reliability
description:
DoD:
- CI on main is consistently green (checks, e2e, lighthouse, nightly visual) and failures have clear, actionable output.
- CD deploy workflow reliably builds, pushes, deploys, and smoke-tests production without manual steps.
- PR workflows degrade gracefully when secrets are unavailable (e.g., fork PRs) without silently skipping critical coverage for trusted branches.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] CI workflows are green on `main` (checks/e2e/lighthouse/nightly/atlas-update) and failures are actionable.
- [ ] CD workflow builds, pushes, deploys, and runs smoke checks reliably.
- [ ] Fork PRs do not fail due to missing secrets; job summary calls out skipped steps.

title: CI: Triage failures and keep main green
description:
DoD:

- Confirm the full CI suite passes on main (multiple consecutive runs) after the fixes.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Identify and fix current CI failures/flakes across `checks.yml`, `e2e.yml`, `cd.yml`, and scheduled workflows.
- [ ] Add/adjust logging/tests so failures are diagnosable from the GitHub Actions UI.
- [ ] Confirm at least 3 consecutive green runs on `main` after fixes.

title: CI: Make secrets-dependent jobs fork-safe
description:
DoD:
- Update workflows that require secrets (e2e.yml, cd.yml) so fork pull requests do not fail due to missing secrets.
- Keep full coverage for trusted contexts (push to main, pull_request from same repo, workflow_dispatch) while skipping only the minimal secret-requiring steps for forks.
- Add explicit, visible messaging in the job summary when steps are skipped due to missing secrets.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Fork PRs do not fail due to missing secrets; secret-dependent steps are skipped with explicit messaging.
- [ ] Trusted contexts (push to `main`, same-repo PRs, workflow_dispatch) run full coverage with secrets.
- [ ] No critical coverage is silently skipped for `main`.

title: CD: Docker buildx + registry cache for faster deploys
description:

- Replace the ad-hoc docker build/push in .github/workflows/cd.yml with docker/build-push-action and BuildKit cache.
- Keep tagging scheme (short SHA) and ensure the built image is what gets deployed to Azure Container Apps.
- Ensure the workflow remains reproducible and does not leak secrets into image layers.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] `cd.yml` uses `docker/build-push-action` (BuildKit) with registry/cache enabled.
- [ ] Deployed image tag/revision matches the built image (short SHA) used for Azure Container Apps.
- [ ] Workflow does not leak secrets into build args or image layers.

title: CD: Improve post-deploy smoke checks and failure diagnostics
description:

- Expand CD smoke checks to cover at least one JSON API endpoint and the health endpoint (and fail fast on non-2xx).
- On failure, emit actionable diagnostics (current revision, recent logs, container app status) in the workflow output while keeping secrets masked.
- Ensure the smoke checks use timeouts and retries to avoid flaky false negatives.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] CD smoke checks hit the health endpoint and at least one JSON API endpoint with timeouts/retries.
- [ ] On failure, workflow outputs actionable diagnostics (revision/status/log pointers) while keeping secrets masked.
- [ ] Smoke checks are reliable enough to avoid flaky false negatives.

title: Epic: Living City Wordmark Playground (V1)
description:
Complete implementation of a living, configurable cityscape wordmark (text "MARKDOWNTOWN") with day/night scenes, time-of-day animation, and a local playground for rapid iteration.

## Objective
Build a configurable, living 2D city logo that can be iterated on quickly (time-of-day, activity, events) and ship it as the primary wordmark across the app (no legacy fallback).

## Success Criteria
- [ ] A CityWordmark simulation engine + renderer exists (seeded + configurable).
- [ ] Day + night visuals are supported (with dawn/dusk transitions).
- [ ] Local playground exists to scrub time-of-day and toggle/trigger activity.
- [ ] Logo can react to site actions via an event bridge (V1: a few key actions only).
- [ ] Tests exist for core sim utilities and visual baselines for key scenes.
- [ ] Performance is acceptable for header usage (bounded CPU/DOM; no layout jank).
- [ ] Existing wordmark is replaced everywhere (no fallback).

- [ ] For every merged change: local verification is done and GitHub Actions CI is green before starting the next issue.
## Out of Scope
- Formal documentation and accessibility audit (explicitly deferred per request).
- Full cross-device QA; we rely on CI + visual baselines initially.

## Assumptions
- Product name remains "mark downtown"; the logo text renders as "MARKDOWNTOWN" (no spaces).
- V1 targets SVG-first rendering + Web Animations API / rAF where needed; Canvas/WebGL can be explored later if warranted.
- Animations are deterministic by seed to keep visual baselines stable.


## Verification Protocol
- Use Node 20 (CI parity): `PATH=/opt/homebrew/opt/node@20/bin:$PATH`
- Run local CI-equivalent checks: `pnpm lint`, `pnpm lint:knip`, `pnpm lint:cycles`, `pnpm type-check`, `pnpm test`, `pnpm build`, `pnpm bundle:check`
- Layout/visual regression: start app (`pnpm build` + `pnpm start`) and run `pnpm test:visual` (update darwin + linux snapshots when intentional)
- Animation sanity: capture 2+ frames via Playwright against the logo playground and confirm motion/state changes are visible
- CI gate: after push, wait for GitHub Actions to be green (e.g. `gh run list -c <sha>` and `gh run watch --exit-status <run-id>`) before starting next issue

description:
Complete implementation of the repo-aligned MarkDowntown redesign plan ("best place for AI coding engineers to import, normalize, remix, and export agent instruction assets across tools").

Ship a unified Library + Workbench + Translate experience built on a canonical UAM v1 model and versioned export adapters for common tools (AGENTS.md/Copilot/Claude/Gemini/Cursor/Windsurf).

- No backwards compatibility is required for old /browse, /templates, /tags, or /builder surfaces; redirects are acceptable.
- Existing "UniversalAgentDefinition" can be migrated or replaced by UAM v1; temporary parallel support is acceptable to keep the codebase shippable.
- We defer accessibility and documentation work unless required for correctness.
- Export formats follow current official docs (Copilot applyTo instructions, Cursor .mdc rules, Windsurf .windsurf/rules, etc.).

title: Epic: Design System V3 — Crisp Technical, Dense, Motion + Mobile
description:
Complete a next-level design system pass tuned for engineering workflows: crisp, information-dense, fast, and consistent across all UI primitives and interactions.

## Objective
- Make the UI feel "premium technical": dense but readable, sharp hierarchy, predictable interaction states.
- Make density + motion first-class (tokens + preferences) so the system is foolproof across new surfaces (Library/Workbench/Translate/Atlas).
- Eliminate styling drift by strengthening primitives and adding guardrails.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Density: compact/comfortable mode works across core primitives (buttons/inputs/tabs/panels) and persists per user in localStorage.
- [ ] Motion: a small, consistent animation vocabulary exists (fade/slide/scale) and is used for Radix overlays (Drawer/Tooltip/etc.) without relying on unknown Tailwind classes.
- [ ] Tokens: semantic tokens cover common UI needs (surfaces, borders, text, status “soft” backgrounds) so components stop inventing ad-hoc colors/alphas.
- [ ] Mobile: key layouts (nav, drawers, multi-pane areas) behave well on small screens and respect safe areas.
- [ ] Guardrails: add at least one automated check to prevent reintroducing raw Tailwind neutral palettes where tokens should be used.

## Assumptions
- Tailwind v4 + CSS variables remains the styling foundation.
- We prefer CSS/utility-based motion (transform/opacity) over heavy animation libraries.
- Accessibility and documentation work is explicitly deferred unless required for correctness.

## Out of Scope
- WCAG/a11y audit and remediation.
- Writing user-facing docs or marketing pages.
- Major IA changes unrelated to design system consistency.

Add a `Kbd` primitive for rendering keyboard shortcuts in a compact, technical style.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `Kbd` renders a monospace inline chip with token-based border/surface.
- [ ] Supports multi-key sequences (render children as text, caller can compose).
- [ ] Unit tests cover basic rendering.

## Files
- src/components/ui/Kbd.tsx (create)
- __tests__/components/Kbd.test.tsx (create)

title: Security: Privacy/terms copy for local folder scans
description:
Clarify privacy and data-handling for local repo scans in user-facing policy pages.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Terms and Privacy pages explicitly state that folder scans stay local and only file paths are read.
- [ ] Copy aligns with simulator UI messaging and avoids implying uploads.
- [ ] Call out refactoring opportunities and follow-up improvements as separate bd tasks if found.

## Files
- src/app/privacy/page.tsx (modify: add local-scan privacy language)
- src/app/terms/page.tsx (modify: refine acceptable-use copy)
